docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 20 -- The Central Committee of the Worker's Federation of Latin America (C. T. A. L.) ended a three-day meeting today and observers saw in its deliberations new evidence that Communist leaders were trying to take over the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 20 -- The Central Committee of the Worker's Federation of Latin America (C. T. A. L.) ended a three-day meeting today and observers saw in its deliberations new evidence that Communist leaders were trying to take over the continent's surging nationalist movement as their own.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 23 -- By the luck of the draw, the Soviet Union will get the first seat in the first row in the United Nations General Assembly Hall when the session opens on Oct. 14.

headline.main: SOVIET GETS FIRST SEAT; Draw at U. N. Gives It Position in Assembly Hall
